video.title: Man Fire Food
video.synopsis: From campfires to specialty grills and smokers, host Roger Mooking travels the U.S. to showcase the many creative ways that people cook with fire.

episodes.synopsis: At the Barbecue Exchange, Roger samples pulled pork sandwiches named Heaven and Hell, then tries a sandwich made with corn cakes at Papa KayJoe's BBQ.
episodes.title: BBQ Sandwiches

episodes.synopsis: Roger joins San Antonio chef Johnny Hernandez in his outdoor kitchen and cooks regional Mexican dishes like branzino wrapped in banana leaves.
episodes.title: Fiery Mexican Feast

episodes.synopsis: In Austin, Roger meets a family of coffee roasters and learns about Texas barbecue. Then he's off to Louisiana to sample sausages and tasso ham.
episodes.title: Small Packages, Big Flavors

episodes.synopsis: Roger visits two Carolina classics: Sweatman's roasts whole hogs, while Stamey's Barbecue serves up pulled pork sandwiches with vinegar sauce.
episodes.title: Carolina 'Cue

episodes.synopsis: Exploring culinary diversity in Texas, Roger learns a recipe for Mexican-style short ribs in San Antonio, then visits Elgin for German-style sausages.
episodes.title: Global Flavors of Texas

episodes.synopsis: Dishes like ham steaks with redeye gravy and country ham biscuits take center stage when Roger visits some of the South's best providers of pork.
episodes.title: Hamming It Up

episodes.synopsis: In the heart of New Mexico, Roger helps prepare a pork shoulder at Comida de Campos, a farm and cooking school that uses cone-shaped clay ovens.
episodes.title: Mud and Steel in New Mexico

episodes.synopsis: In central California, Roger visits a vineyard that serves up barbecue at wine-tasting parties and drops in on a caterer known for Argentine asado.
episodes.title: Carnivore's Cookout in CA

episodes.synopsis: Roger visits a sustainable fish farm where the catch of the day is white sturgeon. Then he visits an Elks lodge with a legendary barbecue pit.
episodes.title: West Coast Roasts

episodes.synopsis: On a visit to the Jack Mountain Bushcraft School in Maine, Roger roasts chickens and trout and bakes sourdough biscuits in an outdoor kitchen.
episodes.title: Wilderness Cooking

episodes.synopsis: Roger heads to New England for two cozy fireplace feasts, including Foster's Clambakes' classic combination of shellfish, corn and potatoes.
episodes.title: Fireplace Feast

episodes.synopsis: In New England, Roger meets a cookbook author who demonstrates a unique technique for steaming mussels and a farm owner who rents out pig roast kits.
episodes.title: Playing with Fire

episodes.synopsis: Roger attends a spring celebration in Lancaster, Kentucky, where the feast includes grilled spring chickens and strawberry rhubarb cobbler.
episodes.title: Spring Celebration in Kentucky
